title: ğŸ¤– AWS IoT Job Execution Simulator (Boto3)
learning_description:
This script simulates realistic device behavior during IoT Job execution. It handles
both OTA jobs (with Amazon S3 firmware downloads) and custom jobs (without downloads).
Devices process job documents, download artifacts when needed, and report success/failure
status back to AWS IoT based on configurable success rates.

learning.job_discovery_description:
We'll scan for active IoT Jobs that have pending executions. Jobs in IN_PROGRESS status
contain device executions that are either QUEUED (waiting to start) or IN_PROGRESS
(currently being processed). This simulation will act as those devices, downloading
firmware and reporting back success or failure status.

ğŸ”„ NEXT: We will scan for active jobs and their pending executions
learning.execution_discovery_title: Execution Discovery - Finding Pending Device Tasks
learning.execution_discovery_description:
Now we'll discover all pending job executions for the selected job. Each execution
represents a specific device that needs to receive the firmware update. Executions
can be in QUEUED (not started) or IN_PROGRESS (device is processing) status.

ğŸ”„ NEXT: We will find all pending executions for job '{}'
learning.execution_simulation_title: Execution Simulation - Device Firmware Update Process
learning.execution_simulation_description:
We'll now simulate the complete device job execution process. For each device:
1. Get job execution details and job document from AWS IoT
2. Check if job requires Amazon S3 download (OTA) or is custom operation
3. For OTA jobs: Download firmware from Amazon S3 and process
4. For custom jobs: Simulate operation processing
5. Report SUCCESS or FAILED status back to AWS IoT

ğŸ”„ NEXT: We will process {} executions with {}% success rate
The simulation will automatically detect job type and handle accordingly.
